page.title: 02LOCHALSH PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Lochalsh Primary School which is in the village of Auchtertyre has been on the site for over 100 years.The school has 39 pupils and two teachers.The pupils are split into two classes.One for primaries 1 to 3 has 21 children in it and uses a mobile classroom in the playground.The other is in the old school and it is for primaries 4-7.It has 18 pupils.The school starts at 9.30am and finishes at 3.30pm.The school draws its pupils from a fairly wide distance:Ardnarff in the north, Killilan to the east and Balmacara Square to the west.Many of the children have to be transported to school.There are several visiting teachers who come to the school to teach art,music,piping, Gaelic and remedial work.
